Author: kegan.eth
Content:
So you would have two options
Either directly in an `Update(float timeslice)` or in a `ScriptCallQueue`

I would do in an update. capture the start time
`float start = timeslice;`
then every subsequent update capture the deltaTime
`float dT = timeslice - start;`
now that you have the time since start, you can determine which frame to display
at 24fps you go to the next frame every 41.6666666 ms
so you could do
`int frameNum = Math.Floor(dT / 41.66666) + 1;`
now your frame number will be from 1 to X. Say your video has 1000 frames. Do this
`if(frameNum > 1000) { farmeNum = 1; }`
this way your video will now loop.
Okay so now that we have the frame numbers, you just need to set the image based on that frame number. 
I'd store each video frame like
`???\Some\Path\To\Images\frame_[Num].paa` then you just replace `[Num]` with `frameNum.ToString()` to give you something like
`???\Some\Path\To\Images\frame_2.paa`

Author: kegan.eth
Content: Once you capture the start time, you only ever update it again if you want to restart the video playable from frame #1
